Abstract: This paper provides an overview of introductory sociology, focusing on the essential concepts, theories, and methods that form the foundation of the discipline. It traces the historical development of sociology from its origins in the 19th century to its current status as a diverse and dynamic field. Key figures such as Auguste Comte, Ã‰mile Durkheim, Max Weber, and Karl Marx are discussed, highlighting their contributions to sociological thought. The paper also explores contemporary pedagogical approaches in teaching sociology, emphasizing the importance of engaging students through interactive and inclusive methods. By integrating historical context with modern educational strategies, this review aims to equip beginners with a comprehensive understanding of sociology and its relevance to contemporary social issues.
